title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern pecan pie, a timeless dessert that boasts a perfectly flaky crust and a luscious, nutty filling. This pie is not only a feast for the eyes with its glossy pecan topping but also a comforting slice of Southern tradition that will delight your taste buds.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in the chilled, diced butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix the egg yolk with ice water and stir into the flour mixture until it forms a ball.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out the dough and place it in a 9-inch pie plate.
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Add eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract; blend well.
Pour the filling mixture over the pecans in the crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for an additional 40 to 50 minutes, or until the pie is golden brown and the filling is set.
Allow the pie to cool completely before serving to let the filling firm up.
tips: For a perfectly flaky crust, keep your butter and water ice cold and avoid overworking the dough. Watch the pie closely in the last 10 minutes to prevent the crust edges from burning; you can cover them with foil if needed. Letting the pie cool fully ensures clean slices and a set filling.

structured_content.content: This Southern Pecan Pie II is a beautiful blend of buttery crust and rich, gooey pecan filling that captures the essence of Southern hospitality. The glossy pecan halves on top add a delightful crunch and visual appeal, making every slice a treat for the senses.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 2 hours of active prep
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home with a classic Southern twist
  • Perfect for holidays, family gatherings, or special occasions
  • Uses simple pantry staples and fresh pecans for authentic taste
  • The flaky crust and rich filling create a perfect texture contrast

structured_content.content: I first tried this recipe when my friend Joyce shared it with me, and it instantly became a family favorite. Every time I bake it, the warm aroma fills the house, bringing back memories of cozy Southern afternoons and joyful celebrations.

• Main ingredient: Fresh pecan halves provide the signature crunch and nutty flavor essential to this pie. Choose high-quality pecans for the best taste.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract enhances the sweetness and depth of the filling, while a touch of salt balances the flavors.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter and eggs create a rich, tender crust and smooth filling, while corn syrup adds the classic glossy texture.
  • Equipment needed: Mixing bowls, pie plate, rolling pin, and oven are essential for perfect results.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in cold butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk mixed with ice water to form dough. Chill for at least 1 hour to relax gluten and firm the dough.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and fit into pie plate. Layer pecans evenly. Mix filling ingredients thoroughly and pour over pecans. Bake at high heat for 10 minutes, then reduce temperature and bake until golden and set.
Finishing Touches:
Cool completely on a wire rack to allow filling to set. Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled for best texture.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Start baking at a high temperature to set the crust quickly and prevent sogginess.
  • Avoid overbaking which can cause the filling to crack or become too dry.
  • The pie is ready when the filling is set and no longer jiggles in the center.
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerate for up to 4 days; reheat gently if desired.

structured_content.content: Sharing this pie with family always brings a smile and sparks stories of Southern traditions. It’s a dessert that connects generations and creates lasting memories around the table.

Enhance the pie by adding a splash of bourbon or a pinch of cinnamon to the filling for warmth and complexity. Toasting the pecans lightly before baking intensifies their flavor and adds a delightful aroma.

Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a dollop of whipped cream. Pair with a cup of strong coffee or a glass of sweet dessert wine for an indulgent experience. Perfect for festive dinners or casual weekend treats.

For a gluten-free version, use a gluten-free flour blend for the crust. Vegan adaptations can be made by substituting butter with coconut oil and using flax eggs instead of chicken eggs, though texture will vary slightly. Try adding chocolate chips or dried fruit for a unique twist.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Keep all crust ingredients cold to ensure flakiness and prevent toughness.
  • Mix filling ingredients gently to avoid incorporating too much air, which can cause cracking.
  • Use a pie shield or foil to protect crust edges from burning during baking.
  • Brush the crust edges with egg wash for a golden, glossy finish.

structured_content.content: With this Southern Pecan Pie II recipe, you’re set to impress your loved ones with a dessert that’s as beautiful as it is delicious. Embrace the joy of baking and savor every bite of this Southern classic!
